# Plotting a normal distribution

<br><br>\vspace{10mm}

I'm getting errors if I enter a value for 'xval' below the mean, especially if it's a negative number (e.g. in a standard plot with \(\mu=0\) and \(\sigma=1\)) but my brain is throbbing from too much R so I'll sort it out later (unless some kind soul posts a 'Pull' request ... or whatever you call a rescue offer in GitHub)!

<br><br>\vspace{10mm}

```{r label = "basic-nplot", echo =F, error = F, warnings=F, messages = F, out.width = "80%", fig.asp = 0.6, fig.align = "center"}

library(tidyverse)

# Enter required values in this section:
# ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
# What does the random variable describe:
x_name <- "value of the random variable"

# Parameters mean and standard deviation:
mu <- 40
sigma <- 2

# Chosen value of random variable to use as bound of shaded area:
xval <- 40.5

# Choose a colour for your plot:
clr <- "darkred"

# ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

tick_posn <- c(-3, -2, -1, 0 , 1, 2, 3)

ymax <-  dnorm(mu, mean = mu, sd = sigma)

xlim_lo <- 0
xlim_hi <- 0

if (xval < mu | xval == mu) {
  auc_lo <- 0.0001
  auc_hi <- qnorm(xval, mean = mu, sd = sigma)
  xlim_lo <- mu - (3.5 * sigma)
  xlim_hi <- xval
} else {
  auc_lo <- xval
  auc_hi <- qnorm(0.9999, mean = mu, sd = sigma)
  xlim_lo <- xval
  xlim_hi <- mu + (3.5 * sigma)
}

funcShadeAUC <- function(xval) {
    y <- dnorm(xval, mean = mu, sd = sigma)
    y[xval < auc_lo | xval > auc_hi] <- NA
    return(y)
}

base <- ggplot()

base +
  geom_function(
    fun = dnorm, 
    args = list(mean = mu, sd = sigma), 
    colour = clr
  ) +
  stat_function(
    fun = funcShadeAUC,
    geom = "area",
    fill = clr,
    alpha=0.2, 
    xlim = c(xlim_lo, xlim_hi)
  ) +
  geom_segment(
    aes(
      x = mu, 
      y = 0, 
      xend = mu, 
      yend = dnorm(mu, mean = mu, sd = sigma)
      ), 
    linetype = "dotted", 
    colour = clr, 
    alpha = 0.5
  ) +
  geom_segment(
    aes(
      x = mu, 
      y = 0, 
      xend = mu, 
      yend = dnorm(mu, mean = mu, sd = sigma)
      ), 
    linetype = "dotted", 
    colour = clr, 
    alpha = 0.5
  ) +
  geom_segment(
    aes(
      x = mu - sigma, 
      y = 0, 
      xend = mu - sigma, 
      yend = dnorm(mu - sigma, mean = mu, sd = sigma)
      ), 
    linetype = "dotted", 
    colour = clr, 
    alpha = 0.5
  ) +
  theme_bw() + 
  theme(
    text = element_text(family="serif")
  ) +
  geom_segment(
    aes(
      x = mu - (2 * sigma), 
      y = 0, 
      xend = mu - (2 * sigma), 
      yend = dnorm(mu - (2 * sigma), mean = mu, sd = sigma)
      ), 
    linetype = "dotted", 
    colour = clr, 
    alpha = 0.5
  ) +
  geom_segment(
    aes(
      x = mu + sigma, 
      y = 0, 
      xend = mu + sigma, 
      yend = dnorm(mu + sigma, mean = mu, sd = sigma)
      ), 
    linetype = "dotted", 
    colour = clr, 
    alpha = 0.5
  ) +
  theme_bw() + 
  geom_segment(
    aes(
      x = mu + (2 * sigma), 
      y = 0, 
      xend = mu + (2 * sigma), 
      yend = dnorm(mu + (2 * sigma), mean = mu, sd = sigma)
      ), 
    linetype = "dotted", 
    colour = clr, 
    alpha = 0.5
  ) +
  theme_bw() + 
  theme(
    text = element_text(family="serif")
  ) +
  labs(
    title = paste(
      "Normal distribution of random variable with \nmean", sep = " ", 
      mu, 
      "and standard deviation", 
      sigma, 
      "."), 
    subtitle = "", 
    caption = "",  
    y = "Probability",
    x = paste("The ", x_name, sep = "") 
  ) +
  scale_x_continuous(
    expand = c(0, 0), # gap between axis and (0, 0)
    limits = c(mu - (3.5 * sigma), mu + (3.5 * sigma)) 
    # breaks = mu  + (tick_posn * sigma),
    # labels = c("-3sd", "-2sd", "-1sd", mu, "+1sd", "+2sd", "+3sd")
    ) +
  scale_y_continuous(
    limits = c(0, round(ymax * 1.1, digits = 2)),
    breaks = seq(0, ymax * 1.1, by = 0.05),
    expand = c(0, 0)
    ) +
  theme(
    panel.grid = element_line(colour = "white")
  )
```
